result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alijah C Johnson

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Defendant Alijah C Johnson in court.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn applied for SPD and qualified. CT sets PTC once SPD appoints counsel.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Wentao Z.
- Defendant shall not be in the State Street and Langdon area as indicated on attached map. 
- Defendant shall not be in the Capitol Square ban area as indicated on attached map. 
- Defendant shall not be on any University of Wisconsin-Madison property as defined by the attached map. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. except only as necessary for purposes of employment. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

8:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alijah C Johnson in court. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
